fields.summary: Add extra logging in DefaultWebInterfaceManager class

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12997].
  {panel}

I wonder if your team has planned to provide Number of Pages to the page tree node to display
the page count of each category.
For instance.
   Root--NodeA(50)
         |       |-- SubNodeA(30)
         |       |-- SubNodeB(20) 
         |
         |--NodeB(20)
fields.summary: If Page Tree can display the number of children nodes on each node?

fields.description:
We are using MS SQL database and I switch isolation level of database to Snapshot isolation (also I add into confluence.cfg.xml following params - <property name="hibernate.connection.isolation">4096</property>, in addition I replace jtds-1.2.jar on jtds-1.2.2.jar (to work correctly with snapshot isolation)).

Database Connection Transaction Isolation level is not displaying at all and Database Driver Version is 1.2 although it should be 1.2.2
fields.summary: View System Information page >> Database Connection Transaction Isolation level is not displaying at all

fields.description:
I really need to add other people as watchers to a page in confluence.  I can do this in jira (add others as watchers) and it's very very helpful.  Hopefully you will allow this in confluence.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow Anyone to Add a Watcher to a Page

fields.description:
When Confluence is available over HTTPS and clients try to access it with Firefox, the reponse time is very long (7 to 9 seconds instead of 1-2 seconds) because by default Firefox uses no caching mechanism with HTTPS.
A manual configuration involving the "browser.cache.disk_cache_ssl" parameter of Firefox is necessary for people to restore a correct response time. The point is that after this customization ALL web sites using HTTPS are cached, including the sentitive web sites such as bank sites...

As described on the following web site http://blogs.gnome.org/jamesh/2008/05/01/firefox-ssl/ this could be avoided by making Confluence server send the "Cache-Control: public" response header, thus making the server say that a resource can be stored in the disk cache
fields.summary: Enhance response time when using HTTPS with Firefox
Control line thickness in line charts

fields.description:
Am I placing the plugin in the wrong directory for it to be scanned and uploaded?
We upgraded to 2.7.3 from 2.2.10. I placed 3 plugins in plugin-cache.
calendar-plugin-2.6.1.jar  
ImageMapPlugin_v1_0_5.jar  
toc-plugin-2[1].3.2.jar

After a restart, there were only 2 (ImageMapPlugin_v1_0_5.jar , toc-plugin-2.3.2.jar)

We are running a QA instance that should be identical to our production instance. No problems there- restart does not remove any of the plugins.

The word "cache" in the directory name makes me suspect I am not putting  the plugin in the most permanent location.
I could not find any documentation on where to place plugins when we are not putting them in WEB-INF/lib.

Please advise
fields.summary: Calendar plugin installed in plugin-cache disappears with restart

fields.description: When pages are long it is very annoying that editor jumps to the beginning of the page after switching from edit to preview mode and then back. You have to scroll down every time. It would be useful (at least as optional feature in the editor) if cursor and scrollbar will jump to exactly the same location in the editor.
fields.summary: Switching to or from previewing mode in editor should jump to the last cursor position

* Loaded a full backup

fields.summary: BeanCreationException / TypeMismatchException when loading plugin right after installing Confluence 2.9 and loading a full backup
Panels not shown correctly in Internet Explorer 6

fields.description: When editing data in a template, the preview tab does not work.  Click templates, click create page from template.  Give the page a new name and click save.  Now you can edit or enter data into the page.  This preview button does not work.
fields.summary: Templates - the preview button does not work when editing a template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12986].
  {panel}

This news post:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SYSADMIN/2008/09/09/WANdisco+and+other+network+updates

Never appeared on the internal blog page or the RSS feed:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/STAFF/Internal+Blog
fields.summary: News post in staff space didn't appear on internal aggregation/rss

fields.description: When Confluence is configured to use the Classic Theme, both fonts display are different when viewing in "Rich Text" editor mode and "View" mode. Attached, {{Classic_View_WYSIWYG.jpeg}} is the result seen.
fields.summary: Fonts in "Rich Text" editor mode is different over "View" mode when Confluence is configured to use Classic Theme

fields.description:
1. The default crop box size should be 48x48
2. Images smaller than 48x48 (so 30x120 for example) should go to the crop screen, currently it is just added to the profile picture list.
3. The Save button down the bottom is too close to the crop area. In any case, not necessary for such a small screen, could we remove it please?
fields.summary: Profile photo cropping should be 48x48 by default, and allow the editing of pictures smaller than 48x48

fields.description: Currently the profile picture avatars are in a column of three which in small screens means that the delete and set profile picture buttons can be off the the bottom of the screens. No need for this. Let's use the space to the side so that many pictures are shown, and that the upload section text also extends to the right. See screen.
fields.summary: Edit my Profile Picture page should be wider

fields.description: An addition to the URL like '&didyoumean=confluence' will allow tools to track the most common misspelt words and let tools monitor the use of this feature.
fields.summary: Allow tracking of how much Did you mean is used (and most mispelt words)

fields.description:
Currently we're just autowiring plugin modules in the new-style plugins. However, I noticed in the MacroModuleDescriptor that the old-style plugins expect the full lifecycle to happen by calling AutowireCapableBeanFactory.configureBean() on the macro object.

We should make sure that all Plugins 2.0 modules are getting the full lifecycle applied, if this happened with the previous version.
fields.summary: Plugin 2.0 modules need to have proper Spring lifecycle methods calls

fields.description: For example, select panel from the format list and then start typing. You'll notice that the cursor is not in the panel but above it where it was before the format was selected.
fields.summary: Selecting a Confluence format in the RTE then typing doesn't put the cursor in the right place
On Dashboards the german/french translation for "Spaces" and "Recently Updated" is missing.
Add auto-save/draft feature for comments

fields.description: window should be titled and headed "View Wiki Markup" as well for consistency
fields.summary: "View Wiki Markup" option brings up window titled and headed "View Source"
Evaluate usage/statistics of plugins/macros for Confluence

It has been reported that when entering following markup,
two digit numbers in a list are not shown correctly on 
Internet Explorer 7.

# bbb

# ddd

# fff
# ggg
# hhh
# iii
# jjj
# kkk
# lll
# mmm
# nnn
# ooo
{column} {section}
{code}

Could you please file this for the improvement?
fields.summary: Two digit numbers are not shown correctly in a list on IE7

fields.description:
On this page:

  http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=158631203&originalId=166002717

There is no 'see changes between version 18 and version 19' linked.  This is different to how it used to work:

  http://wiki.opensymphony.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=9294&originalId=9311

See the two screenshots for examples
fields.summary: When viewing diffs between pages, there is no longer the option to page between them

fields.description:
(This should be for 2.9.1 - this version was not yet available under "affects versions" when filing this bug).

After updating from 2.9 to 2.9.1, most of my settings were overwritten by their default values.

- public signup got enabled
- the language changed back to english (instead of german)
- e-mail addresses were visible again (instead of masked)
- captchas where disabled
- the welcome message was lost
- the site title and url where changed back to the defaults
- daily backups were still enabled, but now including the attachments (which I had excluded)
- etc


Almost all the settings that I had changed using the web interface were changed. However, I noted that the SMTP server settings were still ok, as were the installed plugins and the user macros.
Also, the settings I had copied (confluence-init.properties and atlassian-user.xml) were fine, too.

other settings where still ok
- SMTP server

Just in case this matters, I am using LDAP authentication against an active directory (using atlassian-user.xml).
fields.summary: default config values restored

fields.description:
Right now you have to use the #requireResource macro or you need to call WebResourceManager.requireResource() somewhere within the request to make resource includes appear in the head of your HTML.
If you set the "global" attribute of your "web-resource" element to "true" the contained resources should be included on every page, even if they were not explicitly required.

Example:

{noformat}
    <web-resource name="Resources" key="resources" global="true">
        <resource name="foo.js" type="download" location="com/atlassian/confluence/extra/bar/foo.js">
        </resource>
    </web-resource>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Allow web resources to be global
Make the view space activity feature available to purchasers of the Confluence Hosted.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12970].
  {panel}

It could be useful to have a functionality to be able to verify the following:
* Access permission to daily backup
* Sufficient space left on drive
* Accessibility and existence  (is the directory on a NAS or Virtual Mapped Drive)

Simple test could run these three tests and provide feedback within the admin screen.

One could take it one step further and add a functionality to check the number of backups created in the directory and delete ones that are *X* days old to clear some space for new backups. Or/And move these backups into an archive and store them away on a 'cheap' Hardisk on a slow&old machine. Keep the expensive one for the good stuff :-)
fields.summary: Verification of daily backup directory

fields.description:
We want to expose certain beans to plugin developers in the new framework:

- services
- managers
- any other beans required to implement useful plugins.
fields.summary: Expose important Spring beans to plugins 2.0 framework

fields.description:
Provide a render mode for notifications such as RSS feed items and emails so that plugins can check if they are in that mode and if so render themselves in a way that doesn't include javascript

example use case: http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CONFJIRA-14

this will require upgrading renderer
fields.summary: Provide a render mode for notifications
Allow/Add ability to have custom plugin objects be sized and viewed in the wysiwyg editor window like an image.

fields.description:
If I insert a tag as follows for a flash object:

!flexChart.swf|height=300,width=200!

The page displays just fine with a 300x200 flash space.  If I then edit the page in any way the height and width are changed to 32.

I can then edit the page again and resize and save and all is well.

Basically, any flash includes on the page have to be resized every time the page is edited.
fields.summary: Resized flash object size is lost when a page is edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12964].
  {panel}

Hi all,

I would like to use the user name and the update/creation date of a page and display it in another page, is there a way to do this?

Example of use:
The user A creates:
 - a page P1 with the label 'project_01' on 09/03.
 - a page P2 with the label 'project_01' on 09/04.
 - a page P3 with the label 'project_02' on 09/04.

The user B creates another page which list in a table the pages with 'project_01' as label. The first column = page name, the second column = user name and the third column = update date.

We should get this:
||Page name||user name||update date||
|P1|A|09/03|
|P2|B|09/04|

Thanks a lot and regards,
Stephane
fields.summary: displaying of an user ID from a page to another page

fields.description:
The generated PDF has a different alignment with the page. For example: the page is using right alignment but the exported page (in PDF) is using left alignment.
The steps to reproduce:
# Create a page contains the following:
{noformat}
!codepanel.bmp|align=right!
{noformat}
# Export the page as PDF. The image will be aligned to left.

Please have a look at the attachment.
fields.summary: Aligned images in pages lose their alignment when exported as PDF

fields.description:
Confluence cuts off a very long code macro. The steps to reproduce:
# Create a new page.
# Fill in the page with code macro containing 2700 lines inside code macro.
fields.summary: Confluence cuts off a very long code macro block

fields.description: Customer wants to have a feature to encrypt a content in Confluence so that only certain users are allowed to see the content.
fields.summary: Feature to encrypt Confluence content

fields.description:
Clicked save on my document and then was politely informed that Hibernate was in arreas:

!Collection was evicted.png!
fields.summary: Hibernate not paying rent: collection was evicted
Crowd fails when doing multi-field user search
Create image map's using the WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
It may be useful to allow option for creating pages if the page user is trying to access doesn't exist. Of course, this has to be optional and in no way removing/disabling the existing valid functionality of sending back {{404 Page Not Found Error}}

For example, one may want to write a XML-RPC client that redirects incoming request from another system to Confluence serving as knowledge repository. However, if the page requested does not exist, having option of actually creating it would be in this case useful. (popping up the {{Add Page}} screen)
fields.summary: Allow option for creating a page if doesn't not exist

Support Chrome

fields.description:
If you put 1 whitespace character, Confluence does not allow you and will give you a error message about not allowing an empty comment. But when you put 2 whitespaces, Confluence stores it as a comment and when you edit the comment, you will find the comment is changed to be newline character instead of 2 whitespaces character.

The steps to reproduce:
# Open any page in Confluence.
# Put 2 whitespaces by pressing backspace keyboard 2 times.
# Click Post. Confluence stores the comment.
# Edit the just-created comment. You will find the comment changed to be new line.
fields.summary: Confluence allows 2 whitespaces character being saved as a comment
provide a {jiraissue:someURL} macro to make it easier to refer to a JIRA issue in a wiki page

fields.description: Recent improvements mean that (if they remain unchanged) the user-search won't work with existing versions of Crowd. We need to make this backwards-compatible.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.10 will require new version of Crowd if usermanagement doesn't improve

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12948].
  {panel}

Quartz, the scheduling subsystem in Confluence, expects the system clock to work.  If the system clock jumps backwards, then any tasks that were scheduled before the backward jump will not occur until the clock catches up again.

This has happened at least once on a virtualised machine, and was somewhat difficult to track down.  It manifested most obviously as "indexing stops working for a while, then resumes"

Ideally Confluence or Quartz would guard against weird time fluctuations in some way.

(Note that I've put this in the Search/Indexing component because there's no "scheduled jobs" component)
fields.summary: Guard against badly broken system clocks
Do not allow older versions of Confluence to run against newer Confluence homes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12945].
  {panel}

Sometimes, _Did You Mean_ will make a suggestion that when used, returns no results. It would be advantageous to not make a suggestion so as not to get the users hopes up.

See attached images for an example:
* [^Picture 1.png]
* [^Picture 2.png]
fields.summary: Avoid search suggestions that would return no results

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?where=conf_all&queryString=%3Cscript%3Ealert('foo');%3C/script%3E

queryString needs to be escaped. 

This problem is fixed if they turn on Anti-XSS mode. We still need to fix this as anti-xss is not on by default.
fields.summary: XSS in site search action

Epic fail.

fields.description:
same or similar problem as CONF-12434, but was asked to create a new issue

one way to reproduce (may be others but this is how i got it):
* start writing a blog post
* allow the post to get auto-saved (see draft saved in upper right corner)
* leave the blog page
* start writing a blog post again in the same space
* there will be a box asking what to do with the draft, choose discard draft
* type something in the post
* go to preview tab
* get error (see screenshot)

# Browse->Confluence Admin->Manage Groups->confluence-sysadmins->Add Members
# Add a member that is not in the group.

Observe:

!Picture 2.png!

Enjoy™.

fields.description:
This page could do with some love, including an example:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=157448
fields.summary: Please provide example of how to convert wiki text to HTML

fields.description:
I have a fairly simple page with the markup shown below, and each time I save this page, the markup grows and drifts farther from what I really want.  I can reproduce this situation consistently.  Here is the markup that causes the problem:
{noformat:title=noformat added by Don W for ease of copying and pasting from issue}
Proposed eSignature Meeting Schedule
{panel}
* [Call on -August 27- September 3|Meeting of September 3 2008]
** ThinkTank Session on [Alternatives Analysis]
** Map e-signature alternatives to OMB assurance levels
** Likely Criteria
*** Risk Mitigation
*** Usability
*** Ease of Implementation
*** Affordability
{panel}
{noformat}
To reproduce my problem just save this markup in a new page and edit the page, allowing the Rich Text Editor to see the page.  (I presume that if wiki markup were my default editor perhaps this issue would not exhibit itself.)

This isn't a critical issue for me, I just thought you would want to fix it.
fields.summary: Combination of markup can confuse Rich Text Editor resulting in more mangeled markup with each save
Renaming Page doesn't force renaming title contained in {exceprt-include} macro

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page template and enter some contents.
# Save the page template
# Click "Edit" so the edit form opens, and let your session expire (or clear the browser's session).
# When your session has expired, return to the browser window (still showing the template contents in a textarea) and hit "Save", "Preview" or "Cancel" in the edit section.
# You will be redirected to login, so log back in.
# The contents of the template is now missing

In the table {{PAGETEMPLATES}} of Confluence database, a row of a new version of the page template has been created. However, the value for field {{content}} of that row is empty.
fields.summary: Contents of page templates missing while editing and session expires

fields.description:
Some email clients will display daily changes mails without styling.  The email clients include Lotus Notes, and any client that cannot connect directly to the Confluence server, either due to inability of the client, or lack of network connectivity.

The styles broken in those clients because they come from a linked stylesheet rather than being inlined. Note that this is approximately the same bug as CONF-11996 but just for daily changes emails.  The fix for CONF-11996 neglected those particular mails.

The offending stylesheet link is:

{code:html}
<head>
    <base href="http://localhost:8080">
            <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://localhost:8080/s/1415/1/1/_/styles/combined.css?forWysiwyg=true" type="text/css">
</head>
{code}
fields.summary: Styles are lost in Confluence Digest mail (Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours)

fields.description:
The header and the footer in the "Create Space" page is broken when Confluence is configured to use the Confluence Classic Theme or the Left Navigation Theme as the Global theme. 
Attached, {{createspacepage.jpg}} is the result seen when creating a space after Confluence configured to use the Confluence Classic theme as the Global theme.
fields.summary: Layout problem in "Create Space" page when Confluence is configured to use Classic of Left Navigation theme as the Global theme

fields.description:
On implementing CONF-12918 there is now an additional factor involved in ranking search results which should probably be documented at -

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Ranking+of+Search+Results

This new factor is the age of a result. The boosting is quite coarse grained and is as follows -

|| Document Creation Time || Boost Factor ||
| Today | 1.5 |
| Yesterday | 1.3 |
| Up to 1 week ago | 1.25 |
| Up to 1 month ago | 1.2 |
| Up to 3 months ago | 1.15 |
| Up to 6 months ago | 1.10 |
| Up to 1 Year ago | 1.05 |
| Beyond a year | no boost |

The boost factor is pretty small so want have a large affect. However if two documents match in all other ways then the newer one will be presented first. However, if two documents being compared are both older than a year then their relative recentness does not matter.
fields.summary: Improvement to search ranking needs to be documented

We need to include this case in the form validation.

As a side note, the field errors contain exclamation marks. These should be removed.

fields.description:
I had a seraph cookie (remember me) that was created using the /confluence path as well as a cookie under the / path.

When I log out the /confluence cookie is deleted but not the / cookie.

If I restart, and visit http://localhost:8080/confluence again I am logged in using the / cookie.

We should be consistent, either delete both cookies or only use one.

I can't think of many situations where someone would have 2 instances of confluence on the same server so this shouldn't affect many people.
fields.summary: confluence remember me cookie is not scoped by path

fields.description:
When editing a blog post/news item, you can't provide a short comment to describe your changes. We should allow this when editing a blog post.

Tested on CAC and EAC, Confluence 2.9.1 and 2.10-m1.
fields.summary: Allow user to enter change comment when editing news item/blog post
Wrapping a {dynamictasklist} in {center} causes task metadata to be displayed.
In notification for a page with a table of contents {toc}, anchor links are broken because they are relative, not absolute

fields.description:
When trying to upload a file named sdlkj`fd+s#@.bmp you get the very explicit error message:
"sdlkj`fd+s#@.bmp contains illegal characters (&, +, ?, | or =). You cannot upload files with names containing these characters. "

When trying to upload a file named 2008-08-29=11:05:41.267959 you get this less explicit message, which is especially unfortunate because the two colons in sequence are easily overlooked as a typo:
"The filename of the file contains an invalid character: :"

If the first error message was always used (and mentioned that colons were illegal), this would be helpful.
fields.summary: Inconsistent error messages re: invalid characters for filenames of attachments

fields.description:
Tested and verified in both customer enviornment and in test enviornment.

In the event that you have a parent page restriction and a child page that inherits that restriction, upon upgrade, 2.9 will only respect the explicit parent permission in terms of security trims and actual access but not respect inherited child permissions.  This only affects permissions that were in place prior to upgrade.  New restrictions placed upon pages work fine.

When editing pages that are inheriting page restrictions, the page restrictions are shown to be in place, though the actual restrictions are not respected.
fields.summary: Pages that inherit page restrictions are not respecting those restrictions after upgrade to Confluence 2.9

fields.description:
A user is seeing MULTIPLE duplicate entries come in even when a confluence page is updated once.  They get 30-50 notifications in their feed reader (Outlook and FeedReader) for a single update and all those duplicates do not show up at the same time. They keep coming in even a few hours after the first one comes in.

The source of the problem may be related to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8589 but the results are slightly different.
fields.summary: RSS Feed generating multiple messages for a single page change

fields.description: jiraportlet macro shows the portlet twice. This problem does not appear in Confluence 2.7.1 and Confluence 2.8.2 but only appears in Confluence 2.9.0. Please have a look at the attachment for better clarification.
fields.summary: Jiraportlet macro displays JIRA's portlet twice

fields.description: The only global control for anonymous users is the "can use" option in Global Permissions. To avoid malicious anonymous editing and comments, we need to ensure that no space administrator grants more than View permission for anonymous users.   At the moment, we just monitor all spaces by looking in the MySQL database, and deal with undesirable anonymous permissions when we spot them.
fields.summary: Facilty to restrict the permissions that can be granted to anonymous users

fields.description: Please find the attachment on the steps to reproduce. The bug happens in Confluence 2.8.1 but it has been fixed in Confluence 2.9.0
fields.summary: Using Confluence's Text editor via iFRAME in IE6

fields.description:
Currently the error message is something hard to understand: "IllegalArgumentException: Bundled zip url cannot be null". The point of the IAE in the BundledPluginLoader constructor is a pre-condition on the arguments to this method, so Confluence shouldn't be passing a null URL here.

We should check that the classpath resource exists before calling the constructor, and throw an exception with a meaningful error message, including where we're looking for the ZIP file.
fields.summary: Improve bundled plugins missing error message

fields.description:
The values displayed on the Cache statistics page refer to the number of objects "expired" and not the "expiry-delay".
Please update the title to "Expired" instead of "Expiry", to avoid confusion
fields.summary: "Expiry" should be changed to "Expired" in the Cache statistics page

fields.description:
Users have deactivated 'userXXX'  and others by removing them from ALL groups (e.g confluence-users) except the Active Directory group, which  does not have the 'can use' permission. Thus, they should not  take up a license count. Users have also done the flush Cache operation.

Problem : 
 
- ''userXXX' ' is listed when users click on manage groups ->  confluence-users.  

- removing a user such as ''userXXX' ' from all groups with 'can use' permission but leaving him in the AD group (which does not have 'can use' permission)  does not reduce the license count. WHY?
fields.summary: Deactivated user is displayed in group
License page should show list of sign up users.

fields.description:
In prior versions of Confluence, it was possible to search the entire number of pages for a given macro, such as {include:mypage}. The Confluence search would then return all pages which contained the text {{{include:mypage}}}. This was quite useful for re-using of text as you could always check easily where a certain include was used.

Our Confluence 2.8 installation does no longer allow searching for macros, and the Confluence version 2.9 you are running doesn't seem to allow that either.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.8.0 does not allow searching for macros

fields.description: If you try to create a page and enter the page title then use the Alt+S keyboard shortcut to save the page (while the cursor is in the page title field), it says that a page title must be entered and erases the existing title that you've just entered.
fields.summary: Using Alt+S keyboard shortcut when editing page title doesn't save the title
Duplicate notices in the footer in the setup screen
Copy and paste from bullet points does not copy the bullets

fields.description:
A misplaced quotation mark in /bin/service.bat in Confluence 2.9 is preventing the correct operation of instances started using this service. The line is:

"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp -XX:MaxPermSize=128m" --JvmMs 128 --JvmMx 256

Should be changed to:

"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp" -XX:MaxPermSize=128m --JvmMs 128 --JvmMx 256

Note the moved quotation mark after the "128m".

This issue is causing a similar error to the following in the logs:

SEVERE: Cannot find specified temporary folder at C:\opt\confluence\confluence-2.9-std\temp -XX:MaxPermSize=128m

The result on my specific instance is recorded in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-22856.

A temporary workaround is to update the line in the service.bat file and re-installing the service, or start Confluence from the startup.bat file instead of running as a service.
fields.summary: Invalid quotation mark syntax in service.bat

fields.description:
Confluence has very slow response over HTTPS as re-downloading un-cached resources. We need improved download strategy supporting serving of multiple web resources described in by a {{WebResourceModuleDescriptor}}.

Relevant report - [Support serving of multiple plugin web resources in one request|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-136]
fields.summary: Slow page rendering when using Confluence via HTTPS / SSL due to lack of caching

fields.description: When creating a new user macro, if you use the same name as a current user macro, confluence will silently overwrite the old one without a warning.
fields.summary: Creating a new user macro with the same name name as an existing one silently clobbers the old macro

fields.description:
The hidden contributorUsername field isn't getting populated when the user clicks (not press enter) to select the user from the drop down.

The autocompleter is not running the callback for selection by click.
fields.summary: Username does not get sent with search when user is chosen by clicking

fields.description: Members of the group confluence-administrators are alerted to restricted pages in daily update emails.  This is inconsistent with the behaviour of the rest of Confluence i.e. within Confluence itself the only way members of this group can get to restricted pages is if they go via Space Admin>Restricted Pages or are given the url.  Browse and Search do not reveal restricted pages.  The only instance in which a restricted page should be visible in a daily update is if the confluence-administrator has a watch on that page.
fields.summary: Members of confluence-administrators receive notifications for changes to restricted pages, including daily update
